personalInfo.clubAffl: Shady Brook Golf Club, Sumterville, FL

tourBios.exmtStatus: Top 16, 1999 SENIOR PGA TOUR National Qualifying Tournament
tourBios.carHigh: 1998: Was conditionally exempt for 1999 after finishing ninth at the SENIOR TOUR National Qualifying Tournament at the Grenelefe Golf and Tennis Resort...Shot rounds of 75-68-73-70 for a two-under-par 286 total.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Credited with a dozen PGA TOUR appearances between 1983-1995, and had four starts on the BUY.COM TOUR during the same period...Failed to make a cut in any of those events...Attended the 1979 PGA TOUR National Qualifying Tournament but did not earn exempt status...Won numerous mini-tour titles in Florida and South Carolina in the senior division, including the Florida Senior Tour and the Sunbelt Senior Tour...Played college golf at the University of South Carolina from 1966-1969...Has had three career holes-in-one.
tourBios.personal: Worked for 25 years as a PGA club professional...Also worked in the banking industry...His father got him started in golf when he was 14 years old...Biggest thrill in the sport was making it through the SENIOR TOUR Q-School and earning his players' card at Grenelefe in 1998...He and his wife lived in a motor home for more than three years while he taught golf and played professionally in anticipation of the SENIOR TOUR...Was a fine youth baseball player and a member of the Little League and Pony League teams that won state titles in South Carolina...Worked with such instructors as Wendell Coffee, Jim Carmichael and Jim Deslondes...Lists Arnold Palmer as one of his heroes.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the PGA TOUR Champions was T11th in 2000 at the EMC Kaanapali Classic.
